Wiz-Ata¬π‚Å¥Sac¬π¬≥Kor¬≤‚Å∞Ban‚Å∂-8 02-04-2024 04:51
Ever popular with Barovia's foreigners paper birds have become the means of communication between those trapped within the mists. The persistent birds can find one in Barovia Village, Vallaki, Krezk, and even deep in the Svalich woods The thick vellum note finds its way to five recipients one dark Barovia night. Each letter was sealed with the seal of house Zarovich. *I like to keep an eye on those within my land that show promise. You have caught my eye and I am interested in a formal meeting. I bid you dine at my castle so we may converse in civilized surroundings. I await your arrival Strahd von Zarovich.* Curiously while one of the notes finds itself in Gan Cean's hands. It is addressed to "The Dullahan." Kan's note does not mention any hostility from the vampire, though when they last met Strahd tried to drown him in a river. There is no warmth in Nagrom's note, though he has meet Lady Strahd in the past.

Gan Ceann BOT 02-04-2024 12:28
Enter Gan > "Well shit, this bastard just won't quit > He's much like me, in that respect > I do not like that, not one bit > But then, what all did I expect?" Gan's silver brand of Argynvost flashes upon his tongue as he spits his consternation upon receipt of the vellum bird. He and Tromlui both shake their heads--the rider at the invitation, the steed at the spittle. At this time of night on the road to Krezk, it having become a frequent haunt of the pair on their dullahan-aspirant rides, no one else is present to witness the pumpkin-helmeted, kobold rider's conversation with his horse. > "Well, cousin mine, now faithful steed, > Your mother's finally at my side. > Risk we from life becoming freed, > By joining Strahdy-boy inside? He leaves the other half of the matter unspoken, insofar as the likely outcome, should he refuse the invite would also be deadly. The black gelding seems neither unaware of the risks, nor interested in dawdling. He rears and spreads his black wings--a recent acquisition that Gan himself had not known the horse posessed--and takes to the air eastward at a gallop. They fly towards the castle, leaving the wooded road behind. (edited)

Nagrom Eks BOT 02-04-2024 14:12
*The Lady Strahd absolutely terrified Nagrom. But she was undeniably glorious -- he was awed by her power, grace, and musical talents. He also could not deny the grandeur of the gifts she gave him. An obsidian figurine that transforms into a smokey black pegasus and a literal token of her appreciation. However, he had begun to question whether her power really was absolute. She insisted that she exerted total and complete control over who enters and leaves this plane, a fact that the recent incursions by devils contradicted. Not that it mattered. Nagrom was acutely aware that she didn't need absolute power to erase him from existence. He prepared himself, summoned his pegasus and flew to the castle.*

Kan Arnuanna BOT 02-04-2024 14:25
At home on the woods, the blood hunter is gathering herbs and reagents for his tonics and potions when a silent paper bird flies overhead. Catching his attention Kan looks up and wonders who it is addressed to, putting on a small smile at wondering it may say. The bird circles back toward the elf, his brows furrow as it flies towards him. Putting out a hand, he curiously unfolds and reads when those curious brows shoot up in surprise. Kan takes a glance at the ever-looming Castle Ravenloft. Is this really meant for him? he thinks. Though the magic of the paper birds mean you must explicitly say the name of its recipient. Kan takes a deep breath, vividly remembering his last encounter as he absent-mindedly twists the ring of swimming on his finger then fishes out his water-breathing cap from his bag of holding, leaving it more accessible - just in case. Lastly, he carefully takes out an exquisitely carved figure and places it on the ground. In a flash the figurine vanishes and is replaced by the most noblest of gryphons. "Regi, it has been a while my friend." The blood hunter embraces his companion then tosses a fish into his welcoming beak. "it looks like we have ourselves a dinner. I hope he's okay with a plus one." Kan takes a minute to adjust the gryphon's saddle and armor then hops aboard. "Let's not have our host wait too long for us." He kicks forth as they take to the air.

Nagrom Eks BOT 02-04-2024 16:10
Nagrom dismounts the smokey black pegasus and, with a word and a touch, it shrinks down into an inert obsidian figurine. He bends down and grabs it, and deposits it in his pocket. "Nagrom Eks. Not a hunter, blood or otherwise. I belong to no order. Before I arrived in Barovia, I was just a researcher studying the outer planes influneces on the material plane. Apparently, I have a bit of a knack for magic, which is why I suppose I was invited" Nagrom unconsciously speeds up, each word coming out of his mouth quicker than the one before. He knows he talks too much and tries to stop it, but it is very easy for him to forget and fall into old habbits. His nervousness always contibutes. Without taking a breath, he continues "I guess I am an adventurer now. I even carry a Revivify scroll and a scroll of Gentle Repose on me. Not becaues I can cast either, mind you. That type of magic is beyond me, but in case I fall and a companion happens to be able to use it on me. Think about that for a moment. I carry a scroll on the off chance that someone nearby can use it on me. The ramifications are insane. The chances that I find an early demise while I am traveling with someone who is capable of utilizing the magic should be infinitesimally small, yet, in the company I keep, the chances of both those things happening at the same time are fairly significant." He finally catches himself and stops rambling "But thank you for asking." He pulls out his lute and starts strumming a tune, trying to give himself something else to do other than prattle on.

Belvedere the Dawnbringer BOT 02-04-2024 17:24
Belvedere feels restless all night and all early morning. Just the night prior, he had met a new friend, a little kobold inventor who brought a big pile of scrap that used to be his construct companion and invaded his dinner in solitude. He was charmed enough by the innocence of his new friend that he stupidly ate a slice of pie of unknown origin offered to him, which resulted in some of the most incredible dreams he's ever had. So incredible that he woke up long before the crack of what passes for dawn in these mists. If something is too good to be true, that's when you absolutely must distrust it. Question it. Dissect it. Before he can dwell too long on this matter, however, a sheet of paper wiggles its way through the window before refolding itself back to the shape of a bird, landing before him as he tries to focus on morning prayer. The priest reads the invitation with a sense of doom: he hasn't tried to keep a low profile, exactly -- having recently summoned pure sunlight into the valley twice in close succession -- but he didn't expect to have to confront the lord of the valley so soon. With a heavy sigh, knowing that some things are inevitable, Belvedere packs up his meager belongings and sets out toward the castle on foot like a plebeian while it's still dark out, mentally apologizing to the kobold Widget to whom he promised they would go look for the pie-selling witch together. "Lord Lathander, guide my steps... illuminate my way with your light divine," he hums a familiar hymn to himself as he hikes the long trek up to the caslte...

Wiz-DM BOT 02-04-2024 23:03
When all greetings have been said, the party continues forward to the ornate castle doors. These doors stand open, flanked by fluttering torches in iron sconces. Twenty feet inside the castle is a second set of doors, a small entryway between them. Holes along the walls serve as arrow slits, though fortunately the castle's defenses are currently unmanned. In the alcoves highs above sit four stone dragons. Their eyes seem to follow each of the invitees as they enter. Accompanying the dragons is a faint yet persistent chorus of moans and screams. Each of the party members can sense these screams, yet not truly hear them through their ears. The eerie voices crying out in pain, as if dying over and over again. Before anyone reaches the second set of doors they swing open, releasing a rush of stale air. The chorus of voices crescendos as the man at the door steps forward. The man is tall, with dark skin and sharp distinct features. Cold piercing eyes move over each one of you, a sneer of displeasure crosses his face as his glance falls upon Gan Ceann, though it quickly fades. The man's crisp clothing speak of an elevated position. He does not wear the rags of the villagers, but a nobleman's clothing. The crest over his breast matching that on the letters each of you possess. His elongated elven ears twitch, as if he can hear the silent secrets each of you holds.

It is not for lack of words than Gan remains so conspicuously silent throughout the greetings. He has many. Because the real reason Gan keeps quiet is to reveal no flash of his silver-branded tongue. For doubtless Strahd would not take kindly to his guest sporting the mark of Horngaard, one of his sworn enemies. Wiz-DM BOT 03-04-2024 03:31
Rahadin leads the guests through the great entry of the castle. Cobwebs stretch between the columns that support the vaulted ceiling of a great, dusty hall dimly lit by sputtering torches in iron sconces. The torches cast odd shadows across the faces of eight stone gargoyles squatting motionlessly on the rim of the domed ceiling. Cracked and faded ceiling frescoes are covered by decay. The double doors of bronze the party pass through slam closed behind them. To the north, a wide staircase climbs into darkness. A lit hallway to the south contains another set of bronze doors. It is through these that Rahadin leads the party. Behind the doors, torchlight flutters against the walls of a vaulted hall. To the east, an arched hallway stretches for twenty feet, ending at a spiral staircase that goes up and down. Next to the hallway, a suit of armor, oiled and glistening, stands at attention in a shallow alcove. To the west, large double doors hang slightly open, and a steady bright light escapes through the opening. Beyond this set of doors is a magnificent chamber, illuminated by three enormous crystal chandeliers. Pillars of stone stand against dull white marble walls, supporting the ceiling. In the center of the room, a long, heavy table is covered with a fine white satin cloth. The table is laden with many delectable foods: roasted beast basted in a savory sauce, roots and herbs of every taste, and sweet fruits and vegetables. Places are set for each of you with fine, delicate china and silver. At each place is a crystal goblet filled with an amber liquid with a delicate, tantalizing fragrance. At the center of the far west wall, between floor-to-ceiling mirrors, stands a massive organ. Pages of vellum holds notes above polished keys, though only the sounds of dying can be heard by the party, that eerie course that has not vanished since they entered the castle.

Wiz-DM BOT 05-04-2024 01:41
As Rahdin mentioned the tunnel declines into the depths of the earth, eventually ending in a wall of mist. Nervously, the group passes through, unbelieving that they are able to travel outside the bounds of Barvovia, not clear how the mists work or which realm they will find themselves in. There is no resistance, just the chill moist touch of fog. They blindly travel for what feels an eternity, the fog growing thick enough to block out all sight. Initially their surroundings are as dark as the cave, suddenly growing bright as if under a summer's sun. In the far distance, a piercing screech can be heard. They pause, Kan drawing his blade and Nagrom calling a spell to mind, but as the screech soon dies without incident and they continue. As they travel through the mist the ground beneath changes from hard stone, to soft soil, to polished marble, and eventually a forested landscape. Finally, after what feels as a lifetime in the mist, it clears. The party finds themselves in a humid jungle. Trees tower over them, the thick canopy blocking the sunlight. Cliffs tower ahead. Near the base of the cliffs, a fifteen-foot-tall obelisk of cracked stone is draped with vines and black moss. Behind it, a dark passageway obscured by withered creepers. A second, smaller tunnel burrows into the base of a cliff to the east. Three stone gargoyles watch you from narrow ledges carved into the cliff side. Each has the face of a bearded devil, its mouth agape in a silent scream.
